summary: This is a series of emails from April 2021 coordinating logistics for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team to review evidence at the US Attorney's office in New York. The emails detail security protocols, schedules, and the involvement of FBI agents and US Marshals in escorting Maxwell and managing sensitive evidence.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the evidence review; she is to be escorted by US Marshals from custody to the proffer room at 500 Pearl Street for her defense team to review evidence.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The sender of the primary email, coordinating the evidence review logistics and security details for Maxwell's transport and the handling of confidential evidence.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: An AUSA from the Southern District of New York expressing gratitude and providing contact information and scheduling details for the evidence review.

connections.description: The FBI agent is coordinating the security and logistics for Maxwell's transport and evidence review session under the custody of US Marshals.
The AUSA is involved in the prosecution case against Maxwell and is helping coordinate the evidence review logistics for the defense.

events.title: Defense evidence review day 1
events.description: Scheduled start of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team review of highly confidential evidence, including images from CDs and Epstein's devices, at 500 Pearl Street.

events.title: Defense evidence review day 2
events.description: Continuation of the defense evidence review session at the US Attorney's office.

events.title: Defense evidence review day 3
events.description: Final scheduled day for the defense evidence review of sensitive materials.

locations: 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York
US Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody in April 2021 and required US Marshal escort for evidence review sessions.
The evidence review involved 'highly confidential images' from CDs and from Jeffrey Epstein's devices that the defense had not previously seen.
Security protocols were strict: Maxwell was to be handcuffed during transport and could only be uncuffed while in the proffer room with her attorneys.
The emails reveal coordination between the FBI, US Attorney's Office, and US Marshals for a multi-day evidence review in Maxwell's criminal case.
